meanings.definition: A person who forecasts the weather on television or radio.
meanings.sent1: The weathercasters on TV tell us if it will rain or shine.
meanings.sent2: I always trust the weathercasters to plan my outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The weathercasters made a funny joke about the sun wearing sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: The weathercasters are like modern-day fortune tellers, predicting the future of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The weathercasters' job is to unravel the mysteries of the clouds and sun for us.

meanings.definition: The act of predicting the weather.
meanings.sent1: I find the accuracy of weathercasters fascinating.
meanings.sent2: Weathercasters use technology to help them make predictions.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the coach tried weathercasters to guess the next play.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like that of weathercasters, always knowing what was coming.
meanings.sent5: The art of weathercasters involves reading the signs in the sky and wind.
